poem:
Title: "In the Virtual Bazaar"

A castle born of brick and click, no mortar,
A virtual market sings the cashless order.
In the depths of cyberspace they barter,
Trade through the ethereal border.
Guarded gates that data charter,
The World Wide Web, a fluid quarter.
Expand, extend, with no distorter,
A seamless tale of digital porter.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "From security to service: five things to consider when choosing a digital payments platform No matter how bricks-and-mortar your business is, it’s likely that you have a digital presence. And making your business digital-friendly is essential, particularly if you are selling online. You might have social media sussed, just about sorted your website, and have plans to expand to new markets. The next piece of the puzzle is ensuring a smooth customer payments process. But". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
